item.title: Rubbish blocking footpath., 30th September
item.description:
In Grangehill Rd, junction with Greenvale Road, there is a large builders bag on the pavement. This is a route to school and the path is used by many people, parents on their way to school and others on their route to the station. Parents who are visually impaired, using white canes, travel to school. On windy days the bag moves a bit, especially the handles, and straddles the path. This obstruction has been there for about two or 3 weeks. Thanks for dealing with.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grangehill Road, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign Too Low, 30th September
item.description:
'Pay By Ringo' sign, to the left of the ramp into the Village Way multi storey car park is too low. Walking up the path from Sainsbury's, to the right of the entrance ramp for cars, I banged my head on the corner of the sign, cutting my forehead- bleeding badly!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Village Way, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large amount of dog fouling on the bend of the cycle path., 30th September
item.description:
There is a huge amount of dog fouling at the corner of the bend of the cycling path. The whole area needs to be cleaned and disinfected as soon as possible, as a lot of pedestrians and cyclists use this area frequently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Peartree Way, East Greenwich, London

item.title: Pavement needs clearing from debris from large tree, 30th September
item.description:
A beautiful but very large tree drops a lot of acorns/general debris on the pavement. It can get very hazardous. The locals try and clear it but it is a hazard. It would be very much appreciated if this could be on the councils list when they cut the grass verges
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Poyntell Crescent, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: O/grown shrubbery in f/path next to 38 Ingleton Ave Welling, 30th September
item.description:
I am writing to request assistance regarding an overgrown area near 34 Ingleton Avenue, DA16 2JU. There is a small access path located next to No. 38 Ingleton Avenue, which leads directly to the back of my garden at 34. I believe this pathway is a public right of way or a shared access path that residents are permitted to use. However, the entrance to this path is currently blocked by overgrown branches and plants, making it difficult or impossible to use. I would like to kindly request if the Council could arrange for the vegetation to be cleared or trimmed back, so that the path can be safely accessed again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ingleton Avenue, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet
